1.text: BE ye followers of me, as I also am of Christ.

2.text: Now I praise you, brethren, that in all things you are mindful of me: and keep my ordinances as I have delivered them to you.

3.text: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.

4.text: Every man praying or prophesying with his head covered, disgraceth his head.

5.text: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head not covered, disgraceth her head: for it is all one as if she were shaven.

6.text: For if a woman be not covered, let her be shorn. But if it be a shame to a woman to be shorn or made bald, let her cover her head.

7.text: The man indeed ought not to cover his head, because he is the image and glory of God; but the woman is the glory of the man.

8.text: For the man is not of the woman, but the woman of the man.

9.text: For the man was not created for the woman, but the woman for the man.

10.text: Therefore ought the woman to have a power over her head, because of the angels.

11.text: But yet neither is the man without the woman, nor the woman without the man, in the Lord.

12.text: For as the woman is of the man, so also is the man by the woman: but all things of God.

13.text: You yourselves judge: doth it become a woman, to pray unto God uncovered?

14.text: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that a man indeed, if he nourish his hair, it is a shame unto him?

15.text: But if a woman nourish her hair, it is a glory to her; for her hair is given to her for a covering.

16.text: But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor the church of God.

17.text: Now this I ordain: not praising you, that you come together not for the better, but for the worse.

18.text: For first of all I hear that when you come together in the church, there are schisms among you; and in part I believe it.

19.text: For there must be also heresies: that they also, who are approved, may be made manifest among you.

20.text: When you come therefore together into one place, it is not now to eat the Lordâ€™s supper.

21.text: For every one taketh before his own supper to eat. And one indeed is hungry and another is drunk.

22.text: What, have you not houses to eat and to drink in? Or despise ye the church of God; and put them to shame that have not ? What shall I say to you? Do I praise you? In this I praise you not.

23.text: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, that the Lord Jesus, the same night in which he was betrayed, took bread.

24.text: And giving thanks, broke, and said: Take ye, and eat: this is my body, which shall be delivered for you: this do for the commemoration of me.

25.text: In like manner also the chalice, after he had supped, saying: This chalice is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as often as you shall drink, for the commemoration of me.

26.text: For as often as you shall eat this bread, and drink the chalice, you shall shew the death of the Lord, until he come.

27.text: Therefore whosoever shall eat this bread, or drink the chalice of the Lord unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and of the blood of the Lord.

28.text: But let a man prove himself: and so let him eat of that bread, and drink of the chalice.

29.text: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh judgment to himself, not discerning the body of the Lord.

30.text: Therefore are there many inform and weak among you, and many sleep.

31.text: But if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

32.text: But whilst we are judged, we are chastised by the Lord, that we be not condemned with this world.

33.text: Wherefore, my brethren, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.

34.text: If any man be hungry, let him eat at home; that you come not together unto judgment. And the rest I will set in order, when I come.
